page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY GODSFIELD
page.content: Godsfield Chapel The chapel was built in the 12th or 13th century by the Knights Hospitallers and consists of the priests two storey house with a squint to the altar and the remains of a chimney, attached to the chapel. All is in a fair state of preservation, privately owned and surrounded by gardens now, but would have been beside the ancient main road from Winchester, Englands capital, to Farnham and London with plenty of pilgrims passing and destitute persons to whom the Knights offered food. There is a local legend that there was a tunnel between Godsfield and Abbotstone village and treasure was found at the Godsfield end and was given to a London museum. One man remembers seeing the Abbotstone end of the tunnel when a boy!
